text:
Hi I have a question regarding serverless functions and api secrets.

I have a serverless function calling a rest api which uses basic authentication.

While the secret is obviously not front facing in the serverless function, I dont want the key to be visible in the git repo. While the repo is private and is likely to always be private, its generally a bad idea to be pushing api secrets to github, and is the sort of thing that would keep me awake at night.

Is there a way I could store the secret, within HubSpot, pull it into my serverless function without exposing the key in the repo?
I have just found the section in the docs about storing secrets. One day Ill learn to actually read documentation properly
